content.text: Describe the motion of the skater between \(t = 0\) and \(t = 3.0s.\)

Use the tangent to calculate the deceleration of the skater at \(t = 9.0s.\)

Fig. 1.1 is a speed–time graph for an ice skater
The width of the metre ruler is \(2.6 \times 10^{-2} \text{m}\) and the thickness of the ruler is \(6.0 \times 10^{-3} \text{m}\)
Define the 'moment' of a force in words

Calculate the density of the wood of the metre ruler

Fig. 2.1 shows a balanced, uniform metre ruler made of wood
Define momentum
Fig. 3.1 shows two toy trains, A and B, on a track
The mass of train A is \(0.45\mathrm{kg}\) and the mass of train B is \(0.21\mathrm{kg}\). The trains do **not** have motors
Train A travels towards train B and they collide
Immediately before the collision:
· the velocity of train A is \(0.34 \text{m/s}\) to the right
· the velocity of train B is \(0.12 \text{m/s}\) to the left
The trains stick together when they collide
Calculate the velocity of the trains immediately after the collision
velocity =
direction
A different train is travelling with a momentum of \(0.26 \text{kg} \text{m/s}\)
The train slows down and stops after 2.1 s
Calculate the average force acting on the train during this time
[Total: 7]
State which container has the larger temperature change over the first 5 minutes. Explain your answer
After 30 minutes, the temperature of the water in container A remains constant
State, in terms of energy transfers, why the temperature remains constant
The experiment is repeated without the lids on the containers
State the name of the additional method of energy transfer that occurs
Fig. 4.1 shows two metal containers, A and B

Container A has a dull black outer surface and container B has a shiny white outer surface. A and B both contain very hot water at time \(= 0\) . The temperature of the water in each container is recorded every minute
Fig. 4.2 shows a metal pan with a wooden handle
Explain why there is a much greater rate of transfer of energy through the metal than through the wood

1. Calculate the energy transferred by the lamp in one year. Give your answer in kWh
2. Calculate the current in the lamp
